Dynamic Cyber Security Leader with 15+ years of experience safeguarding organizational assets, driving enterprise-wide security strategies, and maintaining hands-on technical expertise. Proven success in risk management, threat detection, and compliance with global security standards.

About Me

I'm an experienced Data Engineering Manager with a passion for building scalable data platforms and nurturing high-performing teams. With a robust background in data architecture, analytics engineering, and team leadership, I help organizations transform raw data into valuable business insights.

Currently leading data products development at a major tele-health company, I specialize in modern data stack implementation (dbt, Looker, BigQuery), cloud platforms (GCP, AWS), and data mesh architectures. My teams have consistently delivered solutions that drive significant business impact, including revenue growth, operational efficiency, and improved customer experiences.

Having progressed from Data Analyst to Engineering Manager, I understand the various career stages in the data field and enjoy mentoring others on their professional journey. My approach combines technical expertise with practical business understanding, helping mentees build both the hard and soft skills needed to excel in data careers.

Key Expertise

Technical Skills:

Mentoring Approach

My mentoring style is collaborative and goal-oriented. I believe in providing both theoretical knowledge and practical guidance that can be immediately applied. Sessions are tailored to each mentee's specific needs, whether that's technical skill development, career navigation, or leadership growth.

As someone who has built data teams from the ground up, I offer unique insights into both individual contributor and management career paths in the data field. My mentees benefit from hands-on exercises, real-world case studies, and personalised feedback that accelerates their professional development.

Areas of Focus

  • Data engineering and analytics engineering best practices
  • SQL, Python, dbt, and cloud data platforms

  • Career progression in data roles
  • Leadership skills for technical professionals
  • Interview preparation and resume review

Donavan is a Physics graduate turned into cybersecurity consultant with eight years of experience in technical domains (offensive security), architectural domains (threat modelling, security architecture) and business domains (governance, risk and compliance).

He understands how multiple businesses and operations run, such as government, aviation, transportation, defence and financial sectors. He excels at identifying key cybersecurity solutions to enable companies' cybersecurity compliance, confidence and cost-effectiveness (3 Cs).

He has contributed to the open-source cybersecurity community, such as his series of deliberately vulnerable machines on Vulnhub from 2018 to 2021. He has also conducted talks on both technical and strategic cybersecurity topics at multiple conferences and venues regionally (SECCON and Threat Modelling Connect in Japan, GCC 2025 @ Taiwan, Seasides 2025 @ Goa, Division 0 @ Singapore, Mystikcon remotely), as well as to non-cybersecurity audiences. He has also conducted career talks to inspire younger students at both the middle school and university levels to consider cybersecurity as a meaningful career option.

In Thales, he has also led a team to create a made in Singapore cybersecurity gamification experience, "Defend the Breach" (DTB), in three months, where players role-play CISO roles to make difficult cybersecurity decisions, taking into account both cyber and non-cyber factors such as the overall health of the business, manpower and operational requirements.

Donavan has also been on the advisory board at VULNCON since 2024 to provide technical thought leadership. He also moderated a panel with fellow CISO/VP-level cybersecurity executives on the future of cybersecurity. He has also been quoted by "The Pentester Blueprint" written by Phillip L. Wylie and Kim Crawley, and Offensive Security. He also contributes to the ISC2's Unified Body of Knowledge (UBK) through the Technical Advisory Panel Workshop. Additionally, he has also written articles on ISACA on topics ranging from post-quantum cryptography, to the relations between social sciences and cybersecurity as well as threat modelling.

Donavan also possesses certifications ranging from Offsec certifications (OSCE3, OSCP), ISC2 (CISSP), ISACA (CRISC) and is currently pursuing his Masters in Cybersecurity at Georgia Tech (OMSCY).

On the mentorship front, he has developed and helped two mentees secure jobs, and mentors a dozen mentees.

Find out more about me at https://donavan.sg and my cybersecurity writing at https://donavan.sg/blog.

With over ten years of experience as a Power Systems Engineer in both the electrical engineering field and academia, I specialize in power systems (distribution and transmission) and renewable energy. I hold a PhD in Electrical Engineering from Murdoch University and a Cert IV in Training and Assessment from South Metropolitan TAFE. Additionally, I am a member of IEEE/IES and have numerous publications and certifications in sustainable environment and energy systems.

My core competencies include power systems analysis, design, and optimization; control of remote hybrid microgrids with high PV penetration; PV output forecasting using all-sky imager-based techniques; and virtual power plant control to minimize PV curtailment. I have applied these skills in various projects with utility companies, engineering consulting firms, and academia. Notably, I contributed to the $1.8 Million ARENA-funded Carnarvon Distributed Energy Resources Trials, collaborating with Horizon Power (Australia), DLR (Germany Aerospace Centre , Solar Research) and Murdoch University. I was one of the early researchers in groundbreaking renewable energy technologies under REDAR (Turkish Republic of Northern Cyprus) and renewable energy techno-economic feasibility studies in Zimbabwe.

I aim to develop and implement innovative and reliable solutions for the energy sector, focusing on decarbonization, transmission power system reinforcement, renewable energy integration, grid stability, and energy efficiency.

Next Century problems require Next Century solutions. As the Founder and CEO of TerraForge Group of Companies (TFG) and Co-Founder and CTO of Next Century Power (NCP), I aim to provide cost-effective and sustainable electrification solutions for Africa and beyond.
